message.content:
cs.HC, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CY, cs.SI 

The paper presents a wearable device that uses multiple sensors to detect eating activities in naturalistic settings. This involves the fusion and classification of data from proximity, ambient light, lean forward angle, and energy signals. The paper also discusses the evaluation of the device with two studies involving obese and non-obese participants. Based on this, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) as the paper focuses on the design and evaluation of a wearable device for capturing human behavior. Other likely sub-categories include Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Information Retrieval (cs.IR) as the paper involves the classification and clustering of sensor data. Cybernetics (cs.CY) and Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) are also possible sub-categories as the paper discusses the potential applications of the device for understanding natural chewing and eating behaviors and enabling real-time interventions.
